      • getRefreshTokenRegular

        public APIRefreshToken getRefreshTokenRegular(APICredentials credentials)
                                       throws DataAccessException
        Get a refresh token
        Parameters:
        credentials - the credentials of the user requesting the refresh token
        Returns:
        a refresh token if the credentials were valid, else null
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.

      • logout

        public void logout(APIRefreshToken refreshToken)
            throws DataAccessException
        Logout and remove refresh token
        Parameters:
        refreshToken - a valid refresh token
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.

      • getRefreshTokenFacebook

        public APIRefreshToken getRefreshTokenFacebook(APICode code)
        Get a refresh token for login by facebook account
        Parameters:
        code - The authorization code received from facebook
        Returns:
        a refresh token

      • getDataDump

        public APIDataDump getDataDump()
                        throws DataAccessException,
                               IllegalAccessException
        Get a data dump of everything in the database. This uses data dump objects to keep things ordered.
        Returns:
        An APIDataDump object containing the entire database
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        IllegalAccessException - This is thrown when illegal id's are being used.

      • getRoles

        Returns:
        list of API roles
        See Also:

        public void changePermission(int userId,
                             APIRole role)
                      throws DataAccessException
        Change the Role of a specific user
        Parameters:
        userId - The iD of the user
        role - The new Role of the user
        Throws:
        DataAccessException - This is thrown when the connection to the database fails.
        See Also:
        APIRole
